text: The pentathlon at the 1934 Women's World Games was held at the White City Stadium in London, from 9 to 11 August 1934. It was the first time a pentathlon event was held at the Women's World Games, after the triatlon event in 1930. The German Gisela Mauermayer won the event in a new pentathlon world record with 377 points ahead of German Grete Busch and Czechoslovak Štepánka Pekárová. Already after the fourth event Mauermayer it became sure she would set a new world record. ==Entrants== On 9 August an incomple list was published of participating athletes. This list consisted of athletes from seven nations: Austria, Czechslovakia, Great Britain, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland. Listed below are the athletes from these nations who were entered for the pentathlon event. Note that there are some discrepancies with those names and the names listed in newspapers during the competition. Nationality Name ==Schedule== ==Results== ===100 metres=== The 100 metres was the first event ====Heat 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Štepánka Pekárová 12.8" 2 Marjorie Okell 13.2" ====Heat 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Irene Phillips 13.2" 2 Pierina Borsani 13.4" ====Heat 3==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Gerda Gottlieb 13.0" 2 Grete Busch 13.2" ====Heat 4==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Gisela Mauermayer 13.0" ====Heat 5==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Marjorie Clark 13.0" ====Heat 6==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Ruth Svedberg 13.2" 2 Maria Kwaśniewska 14.2" Sources: ===Long jump=== The long jump was the 2nd event. Rank Name Nationality Distance Notes Gisela Mauermayer 5.51 m. Source: ===Javelin throw=== The javelin throw was the 3rd event. Rank Name Nationality Distance Notes Gisela Mauermayer 32.95 m. Source: ===Shot put=== The shot put was the 4th event. Rank Name Nationality Distance Notes Gisela Mauermayer 13.44 m. Source: ===High jump=== The high jump was the 5th and last event. Rank Name Nationality Height Notes Gisela Mauermayer 1.52 m. title: Athletics at the 1934 Women's World Games – pentathlon
